results.title: Journey into friendship
results.creator_credit: Wheaton Galentine, Carol Hale and World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how girl scouting and guiding opens the door to lasting friendships between girls of different countries focusing attention on girls from Ceylon, Denmark and Peru who are attending an annual Juliette Low gathering at ‘Our Cabana’ in Cuernavaca Mexico. Shows the girls in their homelands: in Peru making pottery, nursing, teaching native dances; in Denmark cycling and camping; in Ceylon doing social service work in a poverty stricken village. Narrated by Alan Stern. Photographed by Wheaton Galentine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wheaton Galentine, Carol Hale and World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts

results.title: Journey in France
results.creator_credit: Gunther V. Fritsch and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: A picture of France seen through the eyes of the two daughters of a barge family as they travel the rivers and canals from Marseilles to Strasbourg. Presents a panorama of the history, geography, and economy of the country, and portrays the character of the French working people.

results.title: Journey from Zero
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Tim Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A journey northward from Mile Zero, where the Alaska Highway begins, through mountain wilderness. This film covers the route of the travelling library van, a free book service of the Public Library Commission of British Columbia. To oil towns, army bases, mining camps and scattered settlements, the bookmobile delivers a wide assortment of reading material.

results.title: Journey from Etsa
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, David Bairstow, Ghana Government Film Unit and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film presents a story of village life in Ghana, revealing the character and aspirations of the people of this new African nation. Through the patient persistence of young men of the village who seek to modernize ancient, unproductive ways of fishing, we glimpse the wish of a nation to rise to better things.

results.title: Journey for survival
results.creator_credit: Dick Young, United Nations Development Programme, World Health Organisation and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Examines how the provision of safe drinking water to impoverished nations was achieved in Ethiopia, Yemen, Peru, India, Bangladesh and the Philippines. Shows how small technology community action solutions tackle the problem of sanitation and an adequate, clean water supply.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dick Young, United Nations Development Programme, World Health Organisation and UNICEF

results.title: Journey back to Oz
results.brief_description: Your favourite characters from “The Wizard of Oz” return for another adventure with plenty of excitement and new songs. Dorothy’s dream to return to the land of Oz where she experienced a world of magic is fulfilled when another cyclone hits, transporting Dorothy and Toto to Oz. Together they travel to the beautiful Emerald City where the Scarecrow (Mickey Rooney) has become King of Oz. Dorothy befriends Pumpkinhead (Paul Lynde) who tells her of the evil witch, Mombi (Ethel Merman), who has a devilish plot to destroy the city and rule as Queen. Her secret weapon, the brute force of a horde of Green Elephants. Her old friends, The Tinman (Danny Thomas) and The Cowardly Lion (Milton Berle) are unable to help her on this adventure and suggest she seeks help from Glinda, the Good Fairy. Dorothy’s voice is supplied by Liza Minnelli.

results.title: Journey back
results.brief_description: Dramatised account of the rehabilitation of a hemiplegic patient. Deals with the cause and extent of paralysis and demonstrates the work of physical, occupational, recreational and speech therapists and their contribution to the recovery of the patient.

results.title: Journey (Sen)
results.brief_description: A young boy leaves his isolated home town hitching across a forever changing landscape. His travels cause him to relive fragments of the life left behind as he struggles to find rest in a journey that may never end. An award winning short from Indigenous filmmaker Ivan Sen whose other films include Tears, Wind and Dust.
